column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Straighten Out Your Thoughts
#Text=Do you ever find yourself tripping over all of the thoughts in your head ?
#Text=Do you ever just want to straighten them out so you can focus on more important things in life like work , school and relationships ?
#Text=Well here you will find step-by-step ways on how to let your thoughts untangle so you can focus on more important things .
#Text=Steps
#Text=The first thing to do is to tidy your room or house , while doing this your mind will focus on other things , it will give you more room to think .
#Text=While going through your stuff you might be able to unravel some of your thoughts , and also tidy up a bit !
#Text=Look through old photos and relive old times .
#Text=Think about the time you bought or recieved the things you have in your hands .
#Text=Listen to your favourite music .
#Text=Light some nice smelling candles .
#Text=Once you 've had a relaxing cleanse of the area around you its time to clean up your mind , sit down and write down what you felt like when you were going through your stuff .
#Text=Once you 've wrote that down
#Text=write about what you 've done today and who you 've talked to and how that made you feel , what were you thinking while you were talking to them ?
#Text=What do you like about them ?
#Text=What do you dislike ?
#Text=Think about other days that have made you feel happy or sad .
#Text=What happened in these days that were different from others , how can you prevent the sad days and increase the happy days ?
#Text=Write down everything you think about when you think of certain people or objects or subjects .
#Text=Write down why you have a this certain feeling for one thing but not for another .
#Text=What 's the difference ?
#Text=How are you going to make your happy days increase ?
#Text=Now you know and understand what things happen on a happy day you can try do them more often .
#Text=It can be anything big or small like talking to a old friend again or trying out a new sport .
#Text=To finish it of on a positive note
#Text=write down what your goals for the future are , write what you want to do and achieve , write about how your going to achieve this , what are you going to do and change to fufill your goals ?
#Text=After all that thinking you should relax and think about your goals or anything that makes you happy , here are some ideas :
#Text=Take a long relaxing bath .
#Text=Go out for a run and/or exersize .
#Text=Read a book .
#Text=Go out for coffee with a friend .
#Text=Lie down and listen to music .
#Text=Go for a walk out in the park .
#Text=Cuddle up with a loved one .
#Text=Go for a drive somewhere peaceful .
#Text=Stay home
#Text=make yourself some tea and watch your favourite TV shows or movie .
#Text=Everynight while your lying in bed think about :
#Text=How well your doing with your goals
#Text=Think about what you done that day and how that made you feel
#Text=Think about happy days
#Text=Sort though your thoughts by just reliving certain days , pick out everything you felt , ask yourself , Why did I feel this way ?
#Text=Is this a good or bad thing ?
#Text=If bad how can I prevent it ?
#Text=If good how can I continue feeling this way ?
#Text=Everytime your feeling muddled just repeat these steps over and over again .
#Text=You will see improvements because over time you might of have achieved these goals and that is a very good feeling , or you might have new things you want to achieve .
#Text=Never give up on your goals
#Text=keep trying and trying again .
#Text=I believe you can do it .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Remember that its best to write your thoughts down rather than bottle them up .
#Text=Remember what makes a good day and a bad day , how can you decrease the bad days and increase the good ?
#Text=Remember you can achieve your goals if you try hard and work hard .
#Text=Remember ; you have no boundaries .
